nodes.bodyText:
took this from table present in below site
https://bs2manuals.ts.fujitsu.com/psCOBOL2000V16en/cobol2000-reference-manual-13781/data-division-cobol-compiler-reference-manual-120/data-description-entry-cobol-compiler-reference-manual-143/clauses-for-data-description-cobol-compiler-reference-manual-147/picture-clause-cobol-compiler-reference-manual-158
I am not sure , if this is same as IBM cobol.
It would be better to ask Sсott about it

comment from scott:
Fujitsu supports a different COBOL syntax than IBM (similar, but there are differences).  we should be using the IBM syntax instead:
https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SS6SG3_4.2.0/com.ibm.entcobol.doc_4.2/PGandLR/igy3lr50.pdf
If you look at page 211 (PDF page 233), you will see how picture clauses are defined.
This is the same as committed. So, I guess we can keep these.
